subject: Home & DIY
title: Energy-Harvesting Sensors Need No Batteries
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Energy-Harvesting Sensors Need No Batteries.

hook.text: Imagine a sensor powered by your footsteps or the heat difference between a room and an outer wall. No battery needed.

buildup.text: Energy harvesting turns ambient light, heat differences, vibration, or RF signals into power for tiny sensors.

discovery.text: EnOcean switches harvest power from a button pressâ€”no wires, no batteries. They've been deployed since 2001.

twist.text: Harvesters on hot water pipes generate enough power for a temperature sensor and wireless transmitter nonstop.

climax.text: As sensor power needs keep falling, energy harvesting may eliminate the battery replacement problem for good.

punchline.text: The best battery is no battery at all.

quiz.question: How do EnOcean switches generate power?
options: From the mechanical energy of pressing the button
From small solar panels embedded in the switch face
From radio frequency signals emitted by the hub
